Package environment

Class Collector

  • java.lang.Object
    • environment.Collector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Collector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A class for objects responsible for the handling of Outcomes, i.e. completions of any phase in the action-cycle. The collector of a mas is a capital synchronization tool, together with the spheres it manages. An incoming outcome is handled by either integrating it and its syncset in the existing spheres, or by creating a new sphere. Further responsability for the handling of the incoming outcome is left to the spheres.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collector

        public Collector​(AgentImplementations agentImplementations,
                 EOPHandler eOPHandler,
                 Reactor reactor,
                 PostalService postalService)
        Initialize a new Collector with an empty set of Spheres and holding references to the three handlers the environment. At initalization time, a new Thread is created associated with the new Collector instance.
        Parameters:
        eOPHandler - The handler for end of perception tokens.
        reactor - The reactor of this environment
        postalService - The postalService of this environment

    • Method Detail

      • makeNewSphere

        protected Sphere makeNewSphere​(Outcome outc)
        Create a new sphere for the outcome . The set of spheres managed by this collector is extended by the new sphere.
        Parameters:
        outc - The outcome for which a new sphere is initialized.

      • collectOutcome

        public void collectOutcome​(Outcome outcome)
        Deposit the outcome in this Collector's buffer and wake up the thread the latter is associated with, if sleeping.
        Parameters:
        outcome - The outcome to be deposited in the Collector's buffer.

      • run

        public void run()
        If not asleep, monitor the buffer of this Collector for outcomes to be handled.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • requestResume

        public void requestResume()

      • processOutcome

        protected void processOutcome​(Outcome outcome)
        Processes the Outcome . This includes the creation of a new sphere or the merging of existing spheres, and integrating the outcome in the new, resp. merged spheres. Also, the modified spheres are checked whether all its members have acted: if so, that sphere is told do export itself to a matching handler.

      • merge

        protected Sphere merge​(Sphere[] toBeMerged)
        Merges the spheres . One of the spheres to be merged is thereby extended with the contents of the others and the latter are removed from the set of Spheres managed by this Collector.
        Parameters:
        toBeMerged - The set of spheres to be merged.

      • removeSphere

        protected void removeSphere​(Sphere toBeRemoved)
        Removes the sphere from the set of spheres managed by this Collector.
        Parameters:
        toBeRemoved - The Sphere to be removed from the set of Spheres managed by this Collector.

      • getSpheresToBeMerged

        protected Sphere[] getSpheresToBeMerged​(Outcome outc)
        Return the set of spheres that need to be merged for processing the Outcome .
        Parameters:
        outc - The Outcome to be processed by this Collector.
        Returns:
        The set of spheres that need to be merged in order to process .
